intro: Achoriphragma nudicaule, commonly known as the naked-stemmed thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, unbranched stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Achoriphragma nudicaule is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
